nodes.text: Bantha butter, also known as blue butter, was made with blue milk from banthas, giving the butter its blue hue. A common variety of butter, its mellow flavor and tolerance for being heated made it useful for cooking.

In 3 ABY, Devaronian chef Torro Sbazzle was asked by Baron Administrator Lando Calrissian to make a meal for the presumably human Darth Vader after his arrival on Cloud City. One dish Sbazzle chose to make was dumplings, and she considered using bantha butter as it was less risky in flavor than zaffa oil and less likely to burn. She chose the latter as she did not want her possible last meal cooked to be bland.

Bantha butter was introduced to the new canon in "But What Does He Eat?," a short story by S.A. Chakraborty published in the 2020 anthology book From a Certain Point of View: The Empire Strikes Back. The anthology adapts the events of the 1980 original trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back. In the Star Wars Legends continuity, bantha butter was first mentioned in the short story "Soup's On: The Pipe Smoker's Tale" by Jennifer Roberson in the anthology Tales from the Mos Eisley Cantina.
